discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B,C - Controller and Policy

questions.question_text: Which two roles are provided by a local NSX Manager appliance? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
AE should be the corre.

C is correct. However, that occurs after certificates have been signed by the Third-Party CA
Correct Answer is A & E. C is last task

questions.question_text:
A VMware Cloud Foundation administrator has been tasked with replacing self-signed certificates with those signed by a third-party Certificate Authority. A security policy disallows the integration and use of Microsoft Active Directory Certificate Services and prefers an external provider.

Which two steps must be taken in order to configure these certificates? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Create and package the certificates in a domain_name.tar.gz file.
choices.B: Ensure that the external provider has Administrator rights in vCenter.
choices.D: Use the sddcmanager-ssl-util.sh utility to list and delete existing certificates.
choices.E: Generate public-private key pairs using the external provider.
choices.A: Generate Certificate Signing Requests from SDDC Manager.

questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to delete a VMware Cloud Foundation Workload Domain and re-use the attached ESXi hosts by returning them to the list of unassigned hosts in the SDDC Manager inventory.

Which action needs to be taken to complete this task?

choices.D: ESXi hosts need to be decommissioned and updated.
choices.A: ESXi hosts need to be re-imaged and updated.
choices.B: ESXi hosts need to be decommissioned and re-imaged.
choices.C: ESXi hosts need to be re-imaged and rejoined.

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator is tasked with creating a new VI workload domain that will leverage either an external NFS or a VMFS on FC storage as the principal storage.
Which action is required to fulfill this requirement?

choices.A: Create a new network pool for vMotion and NFS networks.
choices.B: Create a new network pool for vMotion, vSAN, and NFS networks.
choices.D: Create a new network pool for vMotion and vSAN networks.
choices.C: Create a new network pool only for vMotion network.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with preparing hosts for the deployment of a new Workload Domain in a VMware Cloud Foundation environment. The ESXi hosts have HBA cards that require the installation of a separate and the most recent VMware Installation Bundles (VIBs).

Which ESXi imaging method should the administrator use?

discussion.content:
A is the correct

Introducing the VMware Imaging Appliance

The VMware Imaging Appliance is included with the VMware Cloud Builder VM:
• With the VMware Imaging Appliance, you can image servers for use in the management domain and workload domains.
• You must have access to the VMware Cloud Builder VM to use the VMware Imaging Appliance.
• If you delete the VMware Cloud Builder VM after the bring-up process, you can redeploy it.
You can use VMware Imaging Appliance to image servers before adding them to VMware Cloud Foundation, as part of the host commissioning process.

From VMware Cloud Foundation: Planning, Management, Operations 4.3 Lesson Book

Selected Answer: A
Preparing the ESXi hosts involves installing the correct version of ESXi and performing some basic configuration tasks. VMware Cloud Foundation supports two methods for preparing these ESXi hosts, either interactively or through the use of the VMware Imaging Appliance service (VIA) which is bundled within VMware Cloud Builder.

Selected Answer: A
VIA is used for this purpose

choices.C: Download and burn the base ESXi Installer ISO Image to a DVD
